perturbation.original_text:
In this Agreement, the following words and expressions shall have the       following meanings:

"Acceptance" or "Accepted"      Means acceptance of any part or the whole of the                                       System by the Publishers when the System                                       has successfully passed the acceptance                                       tests in accordance with Clause 9 below                                       but for the avoidance of doubt does not                                       refer to the continuing Services after the                                       Site goes live
perturbation.changed_text:
In this Agreement, the following words and expressions shall have the       following meanings:

"Acceptance" or "Accepted"      Means approval of any part or the whole of the                                       System by the Publishers when the System                                       has successfully completed the acceptance                                       tests in accordance with Clause 9 below                                       but for the avoidance of doubt does not                                       refer to the continuing Services after the                                       Site goes live
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'acceptance' and 'approval' are used interchangeably without clear definition of their distinct implications. This creates ambiguity about whether a formal acceptance test is sufficient or if additional approval is required, affecting the enforcement of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 12.4. HealthGate will perform the Services and meet the Specifications and             Service Levels set forth and referred to in this Agreement. In all             cases where HealthGate has not committed to a specific performance             standard, HealthGate will use reasonable care in providing the             Services.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.4. HealthGate will perform the Tasks and meet the Specifications and             Service Levels set forth and referred to in this Agreement. In all             cases where HealthGate has not committed to a specific performance             standard, HealthGate will use reasonable care in providing the             Services.
perturbation.explanation: The substitution of 'Services' with 'Tasks' without defining 'Tasks' creates a contradiction. While the agreement specifies 'Services,' introducing 'Tasks' implies a different set of obligations, making it unclear whether HealthGate is responsible for all tasks or only those explicitly defined as 'Services.'

perturbation.original_text: 14.2. In relation to sales the Publishers make direct, the Publishers             shall establish copyright and other fees for such sales ("Article             Fees"). HealthGate shall collect the Article Fees established by             Publishers plus a service fee to be determined by HealthGate but in             any event the service fee may not exceed 30% of the Article Fee for             the particular article, or $US 4, whichever is the higher. Within 60             days of the end of each calendar month, HealthGate shall forward to             Publishers the net Article Fees actually collected (exclusive of             HealthGate's service fee).
perturbation.changed_text: 14.2. In relation to sales the Publishers make direct, the Publishers             shall establish copyright and other fees for such sales ("Article             Fees"). HealthGate shall collect the Sales Fees established by             Publishers plus a service fee to be determined by HealthGate but in             any event the service fee may not exceed 30% of the Article Fee for             the particular article, or $US 4, whichever is the higher. Within 60             days of the end of each calendar month, HealthGate shall forward to             Publishers the net Article Fees actually collected (exclusive of             HealthGate's service fee).
perturbation.explanation: Changing "Article Fees" to "Sales Fees" and then referring back to "Article Fees" creates contradiction as to which fees HealthGate is actually collecting. Whether it's referring to all sales, or only sales associated with "Articles".
perturbation.location: 14. Document Delivery: Fees from Sales of Articles
